items.title: India’s co-working provider names co-founders as co-CEOs
items.author: Karan Chopra, Kunal Mehra
items.summary:
- Table Space appointed co-founders Karan Chopra and Kunal Mehra as co-CEOs.
- Chopra also serves as chairman; Mehra takes on president role.
- Mehra has over five years at Table Space, previously worked at a Taj hotel and JLL.
- Chopra has experience from BoxofE and PurpleYo Technologies.
- Founded in 2017, Table Space serves over 150 clients including Dell and EY.

items.title: ByteDance launches AI code editor for developers
items.summary:
- ByteDance has introduced a new AI code editor named Trae for developers.
- The AI code editor aims to enhance coding efficiency and streamline workflows.
- This launch indicates ByteDance's expansion into the development tools market, leveraging AI technologies.

items.title: These funds have not invested in SEA in the past year
items.summary:
- Funds that have invested in Southeast Asia in the last two years have not participated in any funding rounds in the past 12 months.
- Possible reasons for this include waiting for better investment opportunities, shifting focus away from the region, or the market no longer being a priority.
- Investors should time their outreach accordingly, as many factors influence their investment decisions.

items.title: A list of fundraising startups from Asia and beyond (Updated)
items.summary:
- This article compiles a list of fundraising startups for subscribers.
- Startups can sign up for listing, which provides exposure to investors.
- Investors can receive curated fundraising startups through email subscription options.

items.title: Netflix stock jumps after record subscriber growth
items.summary:
- Netflix added 18.9 million subscribers in Q4 2024, totaling about 302 million, marking its highest quarterly gain ever.
- The company surpassed Wall Street’s expectations with earnings of US$4.27 per share and revenue of US$10.2 billion, a 16% year-on-year increase.
- Netflix's stock rose 13% in after-hours trading, adding nearly US$50 billion to its market value after the announcement of an additional US$15 billion in share buybacks.
- The ad-supported plan costs US$7.99 per month in the US, while the premium package is priced at US$24.99.

items.title: Indian dairy product firm expands with $26m acquisition
items.summary:
- Hatsun Agro Product Ltd (HAP) acquires Milk Mantra Dairy Private Limited for 233 crore rupees ($26 million).
- Milk Mantra becomes a wholly-owned subsidiary, adding brands like Milky Moo and Moo Shake to HAP’s portfolio.
- Acquisition strengthens HAP’s presence in the eastern Indian dairy market, particularly in Odisha, and expands into West Bengal and northern Andhra Pradesh.
- HAP has over 3,700 retail outlets and more than 20 processing plants, operating for over fifty years.
- Milk Mantra, founded in 2009 and operational since 2012, produces packaged milk, curd, paneer, lassi, and flavored milkshakes, reporting a net profit of 9.8 crore rupees ($1.13 million) in FY24.

items.title: Swiggy shares drop 11%, market cap falls to $11.4b
items.summary:
- Swiggy’s shares fell nearly 11% to 427.20 rupees (US$4.94) on Jan. 21, reaching an eight-week low.
- Market capitalization decreased to about 98,380 crore rupees (US$11.4 billion).
- The decline followed Zomato’s weak Q3 FY25 financial results, sparking concerns in the food delivery sector.
- Swiggy is backed by firms like JP Morgan and Axis Capital, with target prices of 730 rupees (US$8.44) and 640 rupees (US$7.40).
- The company is expanding into quick commerce and launched Pyng Professional, alongside establishing Swiggy Sports Private Limited.

items.title: Ex-Meta COO sanctioned for deleting emails
items.summary:
- Sheryl Sandberg, former COO of Meta Platforms, sanctioned by Delaware Chancery Court for deleting emails related to the Cambridge Analytica scandal.
- The judge ruled against her use of a personal email under a pseudonym and the deletion of pertinent messages.
- Sandberg's deletion of emails may have removed crucial information relevant to her defense in the upcoming April trial.
- She is required to cover related costs for shareholders, including the California State Teachers’ Retirement System (CalSTRS).
- Sandberg claims her personal account use was minimal and relevant business information was retained through other recipients.

items.title: Indonesian seaweed firm secures $1.25m seed funding
items.author: Dodon Yamin, Anis Nur Aini, Anthony Kwik
items.summary:
- Banyu, an Indonesian integrated seaweed company, raised $1.25 million in seed funding, led by Intudo.
- Founded in December 2023, Banyu targets issues like low-quality inputs and labor-intensive farming.
- The company sells seaweed for food, biofertilizers, and bioplastics.
- Funding will be used to create a seedling lab and expand operations in Sulawesi.

items.title: Saudi agritech startup secures $2.55m for hydroponic farming
items.author: Lawrence Ong, Christina Khalife
items.summary:
- Saudi agritech startup Arable raised US$2.55 million in seed funding for hydroponic farming.
- The funding round was led by undisclosed investors, with 90% from foreign sources.
- Arable aims to address agricultural challenges like groundwater salinization and limited water resources in Saudi Arabia.
- Founded in 2024 by Lawrence Ong and Christina Khalife, the company designs systems tailored to the local environment.
- 80% of the components for their hydroponic systems can be sourced or produced locally.

items.title: Google DeepMind spinoff to test AI-designed drug this year
items.summary:
- Isomorphic Labs, a spinoff of Google DeepMind, plans to begin trials for AI-designed drugs in 2025.
- The company aims to significantly reduce drug discovery time, potentially from a decade to weeks or months.
- Many pharmaceutical companies remain cautious about the effectiveness of AI in drug development.
- Isomorphic Labs was founded in 2021 and utilizes DeepMind’s AlphaFold tool for modeling molecular structures.

items.title: EFishery allegedly overstated revenue by $600m
items.summary:
- EFishery Pte, an Indonesian agritech startup, is being investigated for inflating revenue and profit figures.
- A draft report claims EFishery overstated revenue by nearly US$600 million for the nine months ending September 2024, with actual revenue at US$157 million.
- The company reported a loss of US$35.4 million instead of a profit of US$16 million.
- Allegations of financial misstatements from prior years have also emerged.
- Internal records show accumulated losses of approximately US$152 million since inception up to November 2024.
- EFishery claimed to operate over 400,000 fish feeders, while the actual number is suggested to be around 24,000.
- CEO Gibran Huzaifah was dismissed after the discrepancies were revealed in December 2024.

items.title: Crypto trading platform Hyperliquid hits $22b daily record
items.summary:
- Hyperliquid achieved a record high of $22 billion in daily trading volume.
- This milestone reflects significant growth in the cryptocurrency trading sector.
- The platform continues to innovate and enhance user experience in crypto trading.

items.title: Bitcoin rises amid Trump’s presidential return
items.summary:
- Bitcoin gained over 2% on Jan. 21, reaching $106,201.70, according to Coin Metrics.
- The broader cryptocurrency market showed a modest recovery with a 1.6% increase in the CoinDesk 20 index.
- This rise is linked to renewed investor optimism following President Trump’s inauguration.
- The US SEC launched a new “crypto task force” on Jan. 21 to establish a regulatory framework for cryptocurrency assets.
- The “Official Trump” token saw a recovery, narrowing its losses to 2.5% after a previous 20% drop, per CoinGecko.

items.title: Taiwan’s chipmaker UMC forecasts Q1 margin below 30%
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- United Microelectronics Corp. (UMC) projects Q1 2025 gross margin may fall below 30%.
- The decline is attributed to a 6.4 magnitude earthquake and a 4-6% drop in product prices.
- Operations at UMC’s Southern Taiwan Science Park were disrupted, leading to employee evacuations.
- Despite this, UMC forecasts a 10% growth in the global semiconductor industry in 2025, fueled by AI servers and increased demand for smartphones and computers.

items.title: US data firm Instabase nets $100m led by Qatar fund
items.summary:
• The Qatar Investment Authority (QIA) has led a US$100 million funding round for US-based data processing firm Instabase.
• The investment raises Instabase’s valuation to US$1.24 billion.
• Other participants include Greylock Partners, NEA, Andreessen Horowitz, and Index Ventures.
• Instabase specializes in processing unstructured data like emails, multimedia files, and PDFs.
• The funds will be used to enhance its AI-powered platform, AI Hub, for distributed enterprises.

items.title: Global semiconductor firms, ITE partner to train SG students
items.summary:
- On Jan. 21, Siltronic and Vanguard International announced a partnership with Singapore’s ITE.
- The partnership aims to prepare students for careers in the semiconductor industry.
- It will sponsor ITE’s Work-Study Diploma (WSDip) program in microelectronics.
- The initiative includes internships and job placements for graduates, with curriculum contributions from partner companies.
- Over 500 students are estimated to benefit from this initiative.

items.title: MicroStrategy acquires $1.1b in bitcoin
items.summary:
- MicroStrategy has acquired $1.1 billion worth of bitcoin.
- This acquisition is part of MicroStrategy's ongoing strategy to increase its bitcoin holdings.
- The company continues to bet on the long-term value of bitcoin despite market volatility.

items.title: IndiaMart’s net profit jumps 48% in Q3 FY25
items.summary:
- IndiaMart reported a 48% increase in net profit, reaching 121 crore rupees (US$14.5 million) in Q3 FY25.
- This profit is up from 81.9 crore rupees (US$9.8 million) during the same quarter last year.
- Revenue from operations increased by 16% to 354.3 crore rupees (US$42.5 million), compared to 305.3 crore rupees (US$36.6 million) in Q3 FY24.
- Sequentially, revenue grew by 1.9% from the previous quarter's 347.7 crore rupees (US$41.7 million).
- IndiaMart's EBITDA rose by 61% year-on-year to 138 crore rupees (US$16.6 million) for the December quarter.

items.title: How CarDekho navigated Carro, Carsome to find space in SEA
items.summary:
- CarDekho SEA secured a US$60 million funding round in December 2024.
- The company generates the majority of its revenue as a finance aggregator, earning an 8% to 10% commission on loans.
- CarDekho aims for profitability by 2026 and plans to expand into Indonesia and the Philippines through acquisitions and its insurance business.
- Unlike competitors Carsome and Carro, CarDekho is not a dealer in the used-car space, choosing a complementary business model instead.
- CarDekho partners with Carro and Carsome, offering financing services preferred by smaller dealers who compete directly with these marketplaces.
- The Indian automotive startups have faced challenges in Southeast Asia, with players like Cars24 exiting markets after short durations.

items.title: North American travel app Hopper eyes $10b IPO
items.summary:
- Hopper Inc. plans an IPO potentially valuing the company at up to $10 billion.
- Founded in 2007, Hopper utilizes data-driven tools to predict prices for flights, hotels, and car rentals.
- The app is especially popular among millennials and Gen Z, being one of the most downloaded travel apps in North America.
- The company has raised over $740 million from investors including Goldman Sachs and Brookfield Asset Management.
- Hopper is considering listings on the Toronto Stock Exchange and Nasdaq, while also open to private equity investments.

items.title: China eases stance on TikTok deal in US
items.summary:
- Chinese authorities may adopt a more flexible stance on TikTok, allowing ByteDance to discuss operations with American investors.
- This change follows a statement from US President Donald Trump expressing interest in a TikTok agreement.
- On January 20, Trump extended a 75-day deadline for American firms regarding TikTok's US operations unless ByteDance divests.

items.title: Indonesia fines Google $12m for unfair business practices
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Indonesia has imposed a $12 million fine on Google for engaging in unfair business practices.
- The fine is part of Indonesia's ongoing efforts to regulate technology companies operating in the country.
- The decision aligns with a broader trend of increased scrutiny and regulatory actions against major tech firms globally.

items.title: SEA motorcycle ecommerce platform nets $10m series A
items.author: Gil Carmo, Sharmeen Looi
items.summary:
- IMotorbike, a Southeast Asia ecommerce platform for pre-owned motorcycles, raised US$10 million in Series A funding.
- The funding was led by Headline Asia with contributions from several investors, including Ondine, 500 Global, Gobi Partners, Astor Management, and Endeavor Catalyst.
- IMotorbike plans to expand in Malaysia and Vietnam, establish a presence in Taiwan, and open new inspection centers and showrooms in Penang and Johor while hiring more staff.

items.title: Ninja Van cuts its path to profitability
items.summary:
- Ninja Van aims to achieve profitability by optimizing operations and reducing costs.
- The logistics company has faced challenges, including operational inefficiencies and intense competition.
- Future growth strategies include expanding services and enhancing technology for better efficiency.

items.title: These are the most active investors in India’s startups
items.summary:
- The article provides a list of the most active investors in India-based startups over the past two years.
- Investors are ranked by the number of deals they have done, with emphasis on those investing in three or more companies.
- The list aims to highlight early-stage investors, and the data is continually updated.

items.title: Indian office space management startup raises $1.5m
items.author: Sawan Laddha
items.summary:
- Workie, an office space management startup, raised 13 crore rupees (around US$1.5 million) in an equity funding round.
- Investors include the Sunil Singhania family office, NAV Capital, Raman Roy, Dharmendra Jain, Gaurav Singhvi, and Sunil Singhvi.
- Founded in 2017, Workie converts commercial properties into flexible workspaces, managing over 15,000 seats in 50 locations across 15 cities in India.

items.title: Tesla’s brand value drops 26% due to Musk’s reputation: research
items.summary:
- Tesla’s brand value decreased by 26% in 2024, falling from $58.3 billion to $43 billion.
- This marks the second consecutive year of brand value decline, attributed to an aging vehicle lineup and CEO Elon Musk’s controversial public behavior.
- In global automotive rankings, Toyota leads with a brand value of $64.7 billion, followed by Mercedes at $53 billion.
- Tesla's reputation and recommendations significantly decreased in Europe and Asia.
- Brand Finance highlights the link between Tesla’s brand image and Musk’s public persona as a potential risk.

items.title: TSMC operations resume after Taiwan earthquake
items.summary:
- TSMC confirmed all facilities operational after a 6.4 magnitude earthquake on Jan. 21.
- The earthquake caused light injuries and minor damage in southern Taiwan.
- Evacuations occurred at some TSMC sites as a precaution, but inspections confirmed safety.
- Operations are gradually returning to normal, with essential systems functioning properly.

items.title: Jio Platforms hires ex-CEO of Disney+ Hostar to lead AI
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Reliance Industries’ Jio Platforms appointed Sajith Sivanandan as president of its Jio Mobile Digital Services division.
- Sivanandan, formerly CEO of Disney+ Hotstar, will spearhead AI-based digital services for Jio Mobile.
- With over 15 years at Google, he held significant roles in management across multiple regions, including as managing director for Google Malaysia.
- This appointment aligns with Jio Platforms’ strategy to enhance digital offerings.

items.title: Trump-linked crypto project buys $112.8m in assets
items.summary:
- World Liberty Financial purchased $112.8 million in cryptocurrencies on January 20, marking Trump’s first day in office.
- The assets included $47 million in Ether and wrapped Bitcoin, as well as $4.7 million each in Aave, LINK, TRX, and ENA tokens.
- World Liberty currently holds 57,115 ETH valued at approximately $185.14 million, constituting over half of its portfolio.
- Other holdings include 54 million USDC worth $54 million and 456.7 WBTC valued at around $46.5 million.
- The project sold 20% of its 100 billion WLFI token supply, raising $300 million, with an additional 5% currently for sale.

items.title: Sea sets up $36.6m AI hubs at NUS
items.summary:
- The National University of Singapore (NUS) will officially open two new AI buildings on Jan. 21.
- Facilities include Sea Building and Sea Connect, developed with a S$50 million donation from Sea Limited.
- This is the largest corporate gift to the NUS School of Computing.
- The inauguration featured Singapore’s education minister Chan Chun Sing as the guest of honor.
- The buildings focus on supporting research, technology education, and collaboration in AI and computing.

items.title: Ethereum Foundation moves $150m in ETH to new wallet
items.summary:
- Ethereum Foundation transferring 50,000 ETH (~$150 million) to a new multisignature wallet.
- Purpose of the wallet is to engage with decentralized finance (DeFi) applications.
- Announced by Hsiao-Wei Wang on January 20; features a Safe 3-of-5 multisig wallet.
- Potential processing delays may affect the transfer time.
- Emphasis on active involvement in the DeFi ecosystem.

items.title: US CFTC names Pham as acting chair
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Caroline D. Pham is the new acting chairman of the CFTC, effective Jan. 20.
- Pham has been a CFTC commissioner since April 2022, with her term expiring in April 2027.
- She replaces Rostin Behnam, who has been chairman since Jan. 4, 2022, and will remain a commissioner until Feb. 7, 2025.

items.title: Apple’s iPhone sales in China drop 18% in holiday quarter
items.summary:
- Apple reported an 18% decline in iPhone sales in China during the holiday quarter.
- The drop is attributed to increased competition from local smartphone brands.
- This downturn reflects broader challenges Apple is facing in the Chinese market.

items.title: Alibaba Cloud unveils new AI models, tools for developers
items.summary:
- Alibaba Cloud unveiled new AI models and upgraded infrastructure at its annual developer summit on Jan. 21.
- Introduced the Qwen2.5 series of proprietary large language models with 7 to 72 billion parameters accessible via Model Studio’s API.
- Launched multimodal AI models: Qwen-VL for vision understanding and Qwen-Audio for audio processing.
- Released tools for developers: Tongyi Lingma (coding assistant) and Workflow (AI task management tool).
- Announced GenAI Empowerment Program to support developers.
- Aimed to reduce AI development costs and foster global collaboration.

items.title: Are SEA’s leading VC funds truly winning?
items.summary:
Data from Alternatives.pe shows funds from East Ventures, Jungle Ventures, and Cocoon Capital registered the highest internal rate of return among their peers in Southeast Asia.
Concerns raised about VC firms relying on AI agents for fundraising, with examples of potential pitfalls and lack of due diligence in the VC process.
The overall performance of Southeast Asian VCs is scrutinized, with some giving lower returns than traditional investments in the stock market.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s biotech startups?
items.summary:
- The article discusses active investors in Southeast Asia's biotech sector.
- It provides a list of investors who have backed biotech startups in the region over the past two years.
- The firms are ranked by the number of deals done, highlighting those that invested in three or more companies recently.
- The data is continuously updated, and feedback on inaccuracies is welcomed by the publishers.
- Access to the full article requires a subscription.

items.title: Indian online pharmacy PharmEasy plans IPO
items.summary:
- PharmEasy is considering its initial public offering (IPO) strategy in February.
- A possible reverse merger with subsidiary Thyrocare may be discussed.
- The company achieved operational cash flow breakeven and reduced losses to 2,533 crore rupees in FY24, down from 5,664 crore rupees in FY23.
- Cost-cutting measures, including lower employee expenses, contributed to this improvement.
- PharmEasy's valuation was cut by 90% in 2023 to US$5.6 billion from 2021, raising 3,500 crore rupees for debt servicing.

items.title: One Mount to invest in Vietnam’s blockchain network
items.summary:
- One Mount Group has been selected by Vietnam’s Ministry of Information and Communications to develop the 'Make-in-Vietnam' Layer 1 blockchain network.
- The announcement was made at the sixth National Forum on Developing Vietnam’s Digital Technology Enterprises.
- One Mount plans to invest between US$200 million and US$500 million into this blockchain initiative, focusing on speed, scalability, security, and robust consensus mechanisms for both domestic and international blockchain development.

items.title: Nvidia CEO highlights company’s impact in China
items.summary:
- Jensen Huang, CEO of Nvidia, visited Beijing on Jan. 19 for a Chinese New Year appreciation event.
- The visit included other cities like Shenzhen and Taipei, with an annual meeting in China on Jan. 20.
- Huang discussed AI’s role in computing and marked Nvidia’s 25 years in China.
- He emphasized the developer ecosystem in China, which has 1.5 million Cuda developers and partnerships with around 3,000 startups.

items.title: Trump rolls back EV policies, halts infrastructure funding
items.summary:
- President Trump signed executive orders on Jan. 20 to reverse EV policies and reduce tailpipe emissions standards from the Biden administration.
- The orders aim to stop funding for EV infrastructure and review federal tax credits for EVs.
- Over $7 billion from the Inflation Reduction Act for EV charging infrastructure will be reassessed.
- Directives instruct federal agencies to identify restrictions that burden domestic energy development, including oil, natural gas, coal, and nuclear energy.

items.title: Blinkit Q3 loss widens to $11m amid expansion plans
items.author: Deepinder Goyal
items.summary:
- Zomato’s Blinkit reported an adjusted EBITDA loss of 103 crore rupees (around US$11.8 million) for Q3 FY25.
- This loss is a 13-fold increase from 8 crore rupees (around US$924,000) in the previous quarter and a 15.7% rise from 89 crore rupees (around US$10.2 million) in Q3 FY24.
- CEO Deepinder Goyal stated that losses are due to investments for expansion, with plans to open 2,000 dark stores by December 2025.
- Blinkit added 368 new stores in the quarter, surpassing 1,000 total stores.
- Revenue increased 120% year-on-year to 1,399 crore rupees (around US$161 million) in Q3 FY25, compared to 644 crore rupees (around US$74.4 million) in Q3 FY24.
- Revenue rose by approximately 21% sequentially from 1,156 crore rupees (around US$134 million) in the previous quarter.

items.title: Trump names Mark Uyeda as acting US SEC chair
items.summary:
- President Donald Trump appointed Mark Uyeda as interim chair of the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC).
- Uyeda is a current SEC commissioner and a Republican, serving until a permanent chair is confirmed.
- He has criticized previous SEC regulations under Gary Gensler, particularly regarding the cryptocurrency sector.
- Uyeda previously worked as securities counsel for former Senator Pat Toomey and advised former SEC Commissioners Michael Piwowar and Paul Atkins.

items.title: Lazada, Peak3 launch digital insurance joint venture in SEA
items.summary:
- Lazada partners with Peak3 to create a digital insurance ecosystem in Southeast Asia.
- Over a dozen insurance products launched since August 2024 across Singapore, Malaysia, Vietnam, Thailand, Indonesia, and the Philippines.
- More than 5 million insurance policies issued, averaging over 70,000 daily.
- Peak3’s SaaS platform integrates insurance services into Lazada’s ecommerce environment.
- Available insurance offerings include gadget protection, product liability, car, accident, and travel insurance accessible via Lazada’s app and website.

items.title: Crypto market sees $1.2b in liquidations amid volatility
items.summary:
- The cryptocurrency market experienced liquidations of US$1.28 billion in 24 hours.
- Over 368,000 traders were affected; long positions accounted for US$816 million while short positions reached US$307 million.
- Bitcoin's price fell by 2.2% to US$103,500 after peaking at US$109,000; Solana and Cardano dropped by 9% and 5% respectively.
- Analysts predict further volatility due to US economic data and Federal Reserve policies; speculation about a US Bitcoin Strategic Reserve is causing uncertainty.

items.title: Indian VC Chiratae Ventures appoints new investments VP
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Chiratae Ventures appointed Saharsh Sharma as vice president of investments.
- Sharma will oversee investments in Northern India, focusing on funding from seed to series B rounds and portfolio management.
- He was formerly an assistant vice president at Orios Venture Partners until December 2024.
- The announcement arrives amid ongoing legal challenges for Chiratae Ventures.
- Chiratae Ventures was founded in 2006 and has invested in over 130 startups, including Flipkart, Lenskart, and Policybazaar.

items.title: TikTok can decide on its US acquisition, Chinese gov’t says
items.summary:
- China responds to Trump’s proposal for TikTok’s US ownership.
- Proposal involves a joint venture with the US holding 50% ownership.
- Chinese foreign ministry spokesperson emphasizes independent business decisions based on market principles.
- Calls for a fair business environment for foreign companies in the US.
- TikTok's popularity in the US highlighted, indicating its significance.

items.title: Zomato shares fall 8% after Q3 profit drop
items.summary:
- Zomato’s shares fell by 8.02% on the BSE, reaching 228.80 rupees (US$2.64) after Q3 FY25 results were released.
- Market capitalization decreased to 2,21,909 crore rupees (US$2.5 billion) with nearly 10 crore shares traded.
- Consolidated net profit dropped by 57.2% year-on-year to 59 crore rupees (US$68 million), down from 138 crore rupees (US$15.9 million).
- Profit decreased by 66% quarter-on-quarter from 176 crore rupees (US$20.3 million).
- Operating revenue increased by 64% year-on-year to 5,405 crore rupees (US$623.7 million).
- Shares closed 3.14% lower at 240.95 rupees (US$2.7).

items.title: India’s quick service app raises $5.5m series A to expand operations
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Snabbit, an on-demand home services app in India, raises $5.5 million in series A funding.
- The funding round is led by Elevation Capital, with participation from Nexus Venture Partners and several angel investors.
- This investment follows a $1 million seed investment from Nexus in early 2024.
- Funds will be used to expand operations and grow the team.
- Snabbit provides services like cleaning, dishwashing, and laundry with a 15-minute arrival guarantee.
- Currently operating in select Mumbai areas, with plans to expand across India.
